entries.title: German Trade Surplus Narrows
entries.description: Germany’s adjusted trade surplus shrank to €22.1 billion in April as import growth outstripped exports, pointing to rising domestic demand.

entries.title: Ipsen Boosts Cancer Research With Marengo Partnership
entries.description: French pharmaceutical company Ipsen is expanding its oncology research partnership with Marengo Therapeutics and will pay the group up to $1.2 billion for the use of its TriSTAR platform.

entries.title: Airbus's Deliveries in Next Months Will Be Decisive
entries.description: Airbus’ 53 planes delivered in May was a sequential and on-year decline, a consequence, perhaps, of the plane maker’s deliveries disrupted by extended breaks in the month, Deutsche Bank said, adding that it’s “too early to draw conclusions, but the...

entries.title: Terminal Rate Expectations Seen Key Mover of 10-Year German Bunds
entries.description: Terminal rate expectations matter for 10-year German Bunds more than what the ECB does from one meeting to the other, Societe Generale Research said.

entries.title: Gold Prices Are Sky-High. Will Gold Miners Follow?
entries.description: While gold prices are already 20% higher than a year ago, after a record-breaking rally, a benchmark gold-mining index is up by just half that.

entries.title: German Industrial Output Falls Unexpectedly
entries.description: German industrial production ticked lower for a second straight month in April, reflecting that hurdles to a sustained rebound remain for the sector, despite an upswing at the start of this year.

entries.title: India Central Bank Stands Pat
entries.description: The Reserve Bank of India held its policy rate steady as Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s election setback raised uncertainty over the country’s future economic and fiscal policies.

entries.title: Samsung Workers in South Korea Stage First-Ever Walkout
entries.description: Samsung Electronics unionized workers staged what they called the first-ever walkout at the South Korean technology giant since it was founded more than five decades ago, taking a day of paid leave en masse.

entries.title: China's Exports Picked Up Pace in May
entries.description: Chinese exports grew at a faster rate in May and beat expectations, thanks to resilient global demand, while import growth slowed.

entries.title: The American Company Trying to Keep Ukraine's Nuclear Reactors Online
entries.description: Westinghouse is replacing Russian fuel and planning to help Kyiv build new reactors

entries.title: Meet the 'Degen' Traders Fueling the Latest Meme-Stock Mania
entries.description: Short for ‘degenerates,’ their risky style of trading has come roaring back in recent weeks. ‘It’s still better than a lottery ticket.’

entries.title: Exclusive: Inside the Radical Plan to Save the Arctic by Refreezing It
entries.description: Deep in the Arctic scientists are experimenting with refreezing techniques in a bid to solve one of mankind’s biggest challenges: stopping the melt of sea ice and saving the planet.

entries.title: Right-wing nationalist parties look set to surge in elections across Europe, but the shock wave from the vote results will travel slowly because of divisions among the political forces.
entries.description: Right-wing nationalist parties look set to surge in elections across Europe, but the shock wave from the vote results will travel slowly because of divisions among the political forces.

entries.title: The NTSB cited poor communication between an air-traffic controller and Southwest pilots after a probe of a near accident at a Texas airport last year.
entries.description: The NTSB cited poor communication between an air-traffic controller and Southwest pilots after a probe of a near accident at a Texas airport last year.

entries.title: SpaceX achieved a milestone with its Starship rocket, guiding the vehicle's spacecraft to a controlled splashdown in the Indian Ocean in its fourth test flight.
entries.description: SpaceX achieved a milestone with its Starship rocket, guiding the vehicle’s spacecraft to a controlled splashdown in the Indian Ocean in its fourth test flight.

entries.title: Leading Chinese battery companies with ties to Ford and Volkswagen should be banned from shipping goods to the U.S., a group of Republican lawmakers said.
entries.description: Leading Chinese battery companies with ties to Ford and Volkswagen should be banned from shipping goods to the U.S., a group of Republican lawmakers said.

entries.title: The ECB lowered interest rates by a quarter point, beginning to reverse a historic series of rate increases and widening a policy gap with the Fed, which isn't expected to follow suit for months.
entries.description: The ECB lowered interest rates by a quarter point, beginning to reverse a historic series of rate increases and widening a policy gap with the Fed, which isn’t expected to follow suit for months.

entries.title: Russia arrested a French employee of a peace-building organization on an allegation of gathering information about its armed forces.
entries.description: Russia arrested a French employee of a peace-building organization on an allegation of gathering information about its armed forces.

entries.title: Hallie Biden, sister-in-law of Hunter Biden, testified Thursday in his trial on gun charges, describing his past addiction in detail.
entries.description: Hallie Biden, sister-in-law of Hunter Biden, testified Thursday in his trial on gun charges, describing his past addiction in detail.

entries.title: The U.S. government has delayed public disclosures of cyber incidents several times since new rules came into force last December, a senior DOJ official said.
entries.description: The U.S. government has delayed public disclosures of cyber incidents several times since new rules came into force last December, a senior DOJ official said.
